alert.note: Alert for City of Roanoke; City of Salem; Roanoke (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 1:43PM EDT until July 09 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: .A cluster of showers with isolated thunderstorms persisted over the Salem and Roanoke City areas. These areas have seen heavy rainfall in recent days. Additional rainfall will quickly runoff and cause minor flooding. If the rainfall persists for longer than the next hour or so, a flash flood warning may be needed. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Virginia, including the following county and independent cities, City of Roanoke, City of Salem and Roanoke. * WHEN...Until 345 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 141 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen in the last 30 minutes and additional heavy rainfall is likely. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Paint Bank Branch, Gum Spring Branch, Roanoke River, Mason Creek, Murray Run, Cook Creek, Carvin Creek, Back Creek, Gish Branch and Horners Branch. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Roanoke... Salem... Vinton... Cave Spring... Hollins... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
